intro: Heliotropium elongatum var. burchellii, commonly known as the slender heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and opposite leaves that are lanceolate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple, blooming throughout the warmer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in open grasslands or along roadsides. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
